# highlight(_:)

**Instance Method**

Highlights (or unhighlights) the button.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func highlight(_ flag: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **flag**: [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to highlight the button; [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] to unhighlight the button.  If the current state of the button matches `flag`, no action is taken.

## Discussion

Highlighting makes the button appear recessed, displays its alternate title or image, or causes the button to appear illuminated.

## Related Documentation

- **setButtonType(_:)**: Sets the button’s type, which affects its user interface and behavior when clicked.

## Managing button state

- **allowsMixedState**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the button allows a mixed state.
- **state**: The button’s state.
- **setNextState()**: Sets the button to its next state.
